newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Police holding second suspect in Hebron shooting.
newsitem.headline: Police holding second suspect in Hebron shooting.

text.p: Israeli police have arrested a second man in connection with Wednesday's shooting of seven Palestinians in the West Bank town of Hebron by an off-duty soldier, security sources said on Thursday.

They described the suspect as a 21-year-old soldier who served in the same army unit with gunman Noam Friedman. Police asked a court to extend his remand by 15 days on suspicions he helped Friedman plan the attack, the sources told Reuters.
The sources identified the soldier as Yuval Jibli of Jerusalem. Israel Radio and the domestic Itim news service said Jibli would be brought before a judge.
An Israeli court on Thursday ordered Friedman, 22, held for 10 days, Itim said. He is suspected of attempted murder and sedition.
Friedman, an Orthodox Jew, fired his M-16 automatic rifle into a crowded outdoor market on Wednesday wounding seven Palestinians before other soldiers overpowered him.
He told investigators he wanted to sabotage any transfer of power to Palestinians in Hebron under an agreement Israel and the PLO were set to sign.
